Format: string OP string, where OP can be any of =, <>, <, >, <= and >=
Languages: Pascal, Object Pascal (Delphi), OCaml, Seed7, Standard ML, BASIC, VB, VB .NET, F#

Format: string OP string, where OP can be any of =, /=, ≠, <, >, <=, ≤ and ≥, Also: EQ, NE, LT, LE, GE and GT
(stringOP? string string), where OP can be any of =, -ci=, <, -ci<, >, -ci>, <=, -ci<=, >= and -ci>= (operators starting with '-ci' are case-insensitive)
(stringOP string string), where OP can be any of =, -ci=, <>, -ci<>, <, -ci<, >, -ci>, <=, -ci<=, >= and -ci>= (operators starting with '-ci' are case-insensitive)
(stringOP string string), where OP can be any of =, -equal, /=, -not-equal, <, -lessp, >, -greaterp, <=, -not-greaterp, >= and -not-lessp (the verbal operators are case-insensitive)
(stringOP string string), where OP can be any of =, /=, <, >, <=, and >=
string OP string, where OP can be any of =, \=, <, >, <= and >=
string OP string, where OP can be any of =, ¬=, <, >, <=, >=, ¬< and ¬>
string OP string, where OP can be any of =, /=, <, >, <= and >=
string OP string, where OP can be any of ==, /=, <, >, =< and >=
string OP string, where OP can be any of ==, /=, <, >, <= and >=
string OP string, where OP can be any of eq, ne, lt, gt, le and ge
string OP string, where OP can be any of ==, !=, <, >, <= and >=
Languages: C++ (STL), C#, D, Go, JavaScript, Python, PHP, Ruby, Rust, Swift, Ya

Format: string OP string, where OP can be any of -eq, -ceq, -ne, -cne, -lt, -clt, -gt, -cgt, -le, -cle, -ge, and -cge (operators starting with 'c' are case-sensitive)
string OP string, where OP can be any of ==, ~=, <, >, <= and >=
string OP string, where OP can be any of =, ~=, <, >, <= and >=
string OP string, where OP can be any of ==, /=, <, >, <= and >=, Also: .EQ., .NE., .LT., .LE., .GT. and .GE.
string OP string where OP can be any of =, <>, <, >, <=, >= as well as worded equivalents
string OP string where OP can be any of ==, <>, <, >, <= and >=
string OP string is available in the syntax, but means comparison of the pointers pointing to the strings, not of the string contents. Use the Compare (integer result) function.
string.METHOD(string) where METHOD is any of eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le
